description: The ship_date must not be earlier than the order_date.
The shipping_zip_code implies the shipping_city. The same zip code must always map to the same city.

If product_category is 'Retail', then product_id determines unit_price. (Meaning: for Retail items, the price is fixed per ID; for other categories like 'Auction' or 'SecondHand', the price for the same ID might vary).
If an order has a parent_order_id, the order_date of the child order must be greater than or equal to the order_date of the parent order.
The line_item_id must be unique across the entire dataset.
Detect near-duplicates in product_name to group items like 'Sony WH-1000XM4' and 'Sony Headphones WH1000XM4' as the same entity.
If return_requested is 'True', then return_date must not be empty.
The customer_email must follow a valid email pattern (e.g., user@domain.com).
The product_url must be a valid URL pointing to the specific domain 'shop-example.com'.
The product_name must be shorter (in character length) than the product_description.
The discount_amount must be less than or equal to the unit_price multiplied by quantity.
Grouped by order_id, the sum of final_total for all line items must equal the recorded total payment transaction (consistency check).
In a product version history (if applicable), later models (higher product_id) should generally not have a lower unit_price than significantly older models of the same category (Monotonicity check).
The unit_price for products in the same product_category should not deviate by more than 3 standard deviations from the category average.
